meta.name: description
meta.content: Porterville Unified School District comprises of 22 schools and is located at Porterville, California.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Porterville Unified School District, Porterville Unified School District Porterville, California.

h3.a: PUSD Meals At No Cost Service

div.div: Starting on April 27, PUSD will provide a once-a-week "grab-and-go" breakfast and lunch meal service from 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. every Monday.

h3.a: PUSD Announces Closure For Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year
Porterville Unified School District Launches New Communication Platform

div.div: ParentSquare, is a new tool that allows PUSD to unify all parent communication from the district, schools, classrooms and school activity groups under one umbrella.

h3.a: Six Pathways Programs Earn 2020 NAF Distinguished Status

div.div: Strathmore High's EAT Pathway and Granite Hills High's LJE Pathway earn upgraded recognition to equal PAB, PAHS, AOE, and APA programs.

h3.a: Monache High MTA and MCTA Pathway Students Advance to SkillsUSA State Competition

div.div: Students to compete in mid-April in Ontario.

h3.a: AmeriCorps Grant to Fund Help for Low-Scoring Students

div.div: Grant will allow PUSD to hire 70 additional staff to assist grades 3-5.

h3.a: Citrus High School Named 2020 California Model Continuation High School

div.div: Site earns recognition for second time in school history.
The first registration session will be February 6 at Olive Street Elementary for the 2020-21 school year.

h3.a: Porterville Military Academy 2020-2021 Application for 7th and 8th Graders

div.div:
Our Vision:
PUSD students will have the skills and knowledge to be prepared for college and career and to make a positive impact in a dynamic global society.
Our Mission:
The mission of PUSD is to provide students a dynamic, engaging and effective educational experience that prepares them with the skills to be productive citizens in a global society.

span.span: Open Choice High School Pathways Programs
Consecutive Years That PUSD Preschools Have Received Tulare County Five-Star Rating

li.a: Future Ready Lab Inspired By Qualcomm® Thinkabit Lab™

STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATION (Title VI of Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1972, California Assembly Bill 699 of 2017):
The District does not discriminate against any person the basis of gender, race, color, religion, national origin, ethnic group, actual or perceived sexual orientation, marital or parental status, immigration and citizenship status, physical or mental disability. The District will take steps to assure that the lack of English will not be a barrier to admission or participation in District programs. Complaints alleging noncompliance with this policy of nondiscrimination should be directed to Julissa Leyva. A copy of the District's Uniform Complaint Policy is available at 559.793.2452.
The District's Title IX Coordinator at 559.793.2445 or the District's 504 Coordinator at 559.793.2473.
